justification: The Apparatus section states: "The NASA Task Load Index (NASA-TLX) was used to measure subjective mental workload (Hart & Staveland, 1988)."

Under Design the authors note a high-load condition "completing a verbal response delayed recall task; 2-back … during hands-off Level 2 automated driving," adding that "2-back has been used as a task to increase cognitive load during manual and automated driving."

measured_by: Standard deviation of horizontal gaze (SD YAW)
justification: In the Gaze behaviour section the measure is introduced: "The standard deviation of horizontal gaze (SD YAW) was calculated … to understand how eye movements change during transitions of control," linking SD YAW to drivers’ visual exploration.

Response-time measures are described as indicators of readiness: "Hands-on steering wheel reaction time (RT HO) referred to the time from the TOR until the driver placed their hands on the steering wheel," capturing the driver’s physical availability to regain control.
